org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.token.provider.saml2

Class DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.token.provider.saml2.DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper

    public class DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
extends Object
implements Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
    See Also:
    Note that end-users can publish soap-sts instances which specify their own implementation of the Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper implementations. This class is built to be readily sub-class-able by such custom implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthnContext

        public String getAuthnContext(List<org.apache.wss4j.dom.handler.WSHandlerResult> securityPolicyBindingTraversalYield)
        Description copied from interface: Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
        Returns the SAML2 AuthnContext class reference corresponding the the SupportingToken specified in the SecurityPolicy bindings protecting a soap-sts instance.
        Specified by:
        getAuthnContext in interface Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
        Parameters:
        securityPolicyBindingTraversalYield - The yield of SecurityPolicy binding verification, as generated by apache wss4j. See the DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper for details on how to parse the classes corresponding to this processing.
        Returns:
        @return A valid AuthnContext value, as defined here: http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/v2.0/saml-authn-context-2.0-os.pdf

      • getAuthnContextForDelegatedToken

        public String getAuthnContextForDelegatedToken(List<org.apache.wss4j.dom.handler.WSHandlerResult> securityPolicyBindingTraversalYield,
                                               org.apache.cxf.sts.request.ReceivedToken delegatedToken)
        Description copied from interface: Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
        Returns the SAML2 AuthnContext class reference for delegated tokens (specified as part of the ActAs/OnBehalfOf element in the RequestSecurityToken). The List<WSHandlerResult> which is the yield of the SecurityPolicy binding traversal, is only provided as additional context, as the manner in which the delegated token was secured may well have bearing on the type of AuthnContext class ref chosen, though it is not examined for the default implementation.
        Specified by:
        getAuthnContextForDelegatedToken in interface Saml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper
        Parameters:
        securityPolicyBindingTraversalYield - The yield of SecurityPolicy binding verification, as generated by apache wss4j. See the DefaultSaml2XmlTokenAuthnContextMapper for details on how to parse the classes corresponding to this processing.
        delegatedToken - The token provided as part of the ActAs/OnBehalfOf element specified in the RequestSecurityToken.
        Returns:
        @return A valid AuthnContext value, as defined here: http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/v2.0/saml-authn-context-2.0-os.pdf

      • getUsernameTokenResult

        protected org.apache.wss4j.dom.engine.WSSecurityEngineResult getUsernameTokenResult(List<org.apache.wss4j.dom.engine.WSSecurityEngineResult> securityEngineResults)
        Parameters:
        securityEngineResults - the results of SecurityPolicy binding enforcement generated by wss4j
        Returns:
        the WSSecurityEngineResult corresponding to a Username SupportingToken - null if no such token was presented.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
